findings.title: Potential incorrect destination in token issuance
findings.description: In the ram.defi contract, the BRAM tokens are first issued to the issuer and then transferred from the contract itself to the target address. However, there is no check for this assumption upon token creation.

findings.title: DoS due to rejected token transfer
findings.description: In the ram.defi contract, it is allowed for users to transfer the BRAM token to the contract, which would be treated as burning the BRAM token and selling the RAM previously bought. However, there is a flawed logic in the implementation of the transfer.

findings.title: Prevent further token creation
findings.description: The ram.defi contract allows privileged accounts to create new tokens through the create function, but since only BRAM token is used, no new tokens should be allowed to be created after the creation of the BRAM token.
